BiblioData.Title: CONTACT LITHOGRAPHY APPARATUS, SYSTEM AND METHOD
BiblioData.Abstract: A contact lithography apparatus 100, 220, system 200 and method 300 use a deformation 320 to facilitate pattern transfer 300. The apparatus 100, 220, system 200 and method 300 include a spacer 120, 226 that provides a spaced apart parallel and proximal orientation 310 of lithographic elements, such as a mask 110, 228a, 222 and a substrate 130, 228b, 224, when in mutual contact with the spacer 120, 226. One or more of the mask 110, 228a, 222, the substrate 130, 228b, 224 and the spacer 120, 226 is deformable, such that deformation 320 thereof facilitates the pattern transfer 300.

Claims.P: 1. A contact lithography apparatus 100, 220 comprising: a mask 110, 228a, 222 having a patterned area 112 with a lithographic pattern; and a spacer 120, 226 disposed between the mask 110, 228a, 222 and a substrate 130, 228b, 224 being patterned, the spacer 120, 226 providing a spaced apart parallel and proximal orientation 310 of the mask 110, 228a, 222 and the substrate 130, 228b, 224 when the mask 110, 228a, 222 and the substrate 130, 228b, 224 are in mutual contact with the spacer 120, 226, wherein one or more of the mask 110, 228a, 222, the substrate 130, 228b, 224 and the spacer 120, 226 is deformable, such that deformation 320 facilitates pattern transfer 300.

2. The contact lithography apparatus 100, 220 of Claim 1, wherein one or both of a lateral alignment 330 and a rotational alignment 330 of the parallel-oriented 310 mask 110, 228a, 222 and substrate 130, 228b, 224 is facilitated by the mutual contact.
3. The contact lithography apparatus 100, 220 of any of Claims 1-2, wherein the spacer 120, 226 is affixed to one or both of the mask 110, 228a, 222 and the substrate 130, 228b, 224.

4. The contact lithography apparatus 100, 220 of any of Claims 1-3, wherein one or both of the mask 110, 228a, 222 and the substrate 130, 228b, 224 comprises the spacer 120, 226, the spacer 120, 226 being fabricated as an integral part of one or both of the mask 110, 228a, 222 and the substrate 130, 228b, 224.

5. The contact lithography apparatus 100, 220 of any of Claims 1-4, wherein the spacer 120, 226 has a spacing dimension S that creates a uniform space between the parallel-oriented 310 mask 110, 228a, 222 and substrate 130, 228b, 224, the spacing dimension S being either a constant cross-sectional diameter of the spacer 120, 226 or a constant height of the spacer 120, 226.

6. The contact lithography apparatus 100, 220 of any of Claims 1-5, wherein the spacer 120, 226 is one or more of plastically deformable, elastically deformable, passively deformable and actively deformable.

7. The contact lithography apparatus 100, 220 of any of Claims 1-6, wherein a contact surface of the spacer 120, 226 is readily slidable on a contact surface of one or both of the mask 110, 228a, 222 and the substrate 130, 228b, 224, a slidability being provided by either a material characteristic of the respective contact surfaces or by a low friction coating material applied to the respective contact surfaces.

8. The contact lithography apparatus 100, 220 of any of Claims 1-7, wherein a contact surface of the spacer 120, 226 is readily slidable on a contact surface of one or both of the mask 110, 228a, 222 and the substrate 130, 228b, 224, the contact surface of one or both of the mask 110, 228a, 222 and the substrate 130, 228b, 224 comprising areas of minimum local relief.

9. The contact lithography apparatus 100, 220 of any of Claims 1 -8, wherein one or both of the mask 110, 228a, 222 and the substrate 130, 228b, 224 is independently one or more of plastically deformable, elastically deformable, passively deformable, actively deformable and transparent.

10. The contact lithography apparatus 100, 220 of any of Claims 1-9 used in a contact lithography system 200, the system 200 comprising a contact mask aligner 210 that aligns 330 the parallel-oriented 310 mask 110, 228a, 222 and substrate 130, 228b, 224 of the apparatus 100, 220, the aligner 210 supporting the apparatus 100, 220 during the deformation-facilitated 320 pattern transfer 300.
